CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is a former employee of ORG of ORG of GPE ( the “ ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant , who was already a tenant of studio No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL in a communal apartment , petitioned various NORP authorities seeking the right to reside in studio No . CARDINAL , which had become vacant in DATE . By a decree of DATE , ORG of Kyiv ( the “ LDC ” ) granted PERSON ( a private person ) the right to use that studio .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged complaints with ORG of GPE ( the “ ORG ” ) , seeking PERSON eviction from the studio . He also requested the court to issue him with a certificate granting him the right to occupy it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as being unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and remitted the case for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant lodged his complaints with ORG against the ORG and the LDC , seeking to quash the decree of CARDINAL DATE and to be allocated studio No . CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE , the court quashed the decree of CARDINAL DATE and recognized the applicant ’s right to use the studio . The court ordered the respondents to take all necessary measures for the applicant ’s enjoyment of his residential LOC and the enforcement of the judgment of DATE . The judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant lodged the writ of execution with ORG of GPE . As a result , the certificate of PERSON granting her the use of studio No . PERSON was annulled .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged the writ of execution with ORG of Kyiv ( the “ ORG ” ) to oblige the ORG , CARDINAL of the owners of the apartment , to certify that he could use studio No . CARDINAL . The execution proceedings were instituted on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE , the applicant lodged several complaints with ORG , ORG of Kyiv ( the “ ORG ” ) , ORG , ORG and ORG of ORG , complaining about the failure of ORG to enforce the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG initiated administrative proceedings against the Logistics Director of the ORG who had failed to execute the judgment given in the applicant ’s favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the ORG informed the applicant and ORG that the applicant had received the keys and free access to studio No . CARDINAL in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fined the Logistics Director of the ORG for failure to comply with the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The Director appealed against this decision as he did not have the power to issue a certificate for the use of the apartment , which power lay with the LDC . ORG allowed the Director ’s appeal on DATE . On DATE ORG dismissed the petition of ORG of DATE by which it had initiated administrative proceedings against the Logistics Director of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was dismissed from his position at the ORG for alleged failure to appear at work for a lengthy period of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued resolution No . CARDINAL granting the applicant the use of studios Nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL . They also petitioned the LDC to issue a certificate ( ордер ) for the applicant ’s use of those studios .
CARDINAL . On DATE the LDC issued decree No . CARDINAL authorising the applicant to use apartments Nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL situated at CARDINAL , FAC in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant about the execution of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the LDC issued a certificate ( ордер на квартиру ) to the applicant recognising his right to use the aforementioned apartments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that the certificate for the use of the appartment was invalid as it concerned apartments No . CARDINAL and DATE , but not studios ORG . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , specified in the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . In DATE the ownership title of appartment No . CARDINAL belonging to the ORG was transferred to the LDC .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was informed by ORG of the LDC that he would be provided with a certificate for his residential LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the LDC issued decree No . DATE acknowledging the applicant ’s right to use studio No . CARDINAL and issued him with a certificate of use on DATE .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the domestic law and practice are cited in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and the admissibility decision in the present case ( PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY , CARDINAL DATE ) .
